title: 2 persons of interest arrested in connection to deadly quadruple shooting
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
DAYTON, Ohio (WDTN) – Two men have been arrested in connection to a deadly Dayton quadruple shooting Tuesday.
Jemarko Walker, Jr. and Curtis McShann are being held on aggravated robbery charges.
The shooting happened around 11:45 p.m. Tuesday near Ryburn and Riverside in Dayton, leaving 27-year-old Brandon Lanier dead.
Dayton Police believe an upwards of 50 rounds were fired.
Dayton Police Lt. Mark Ponichtera says investigators are searching for a black Chevy Impala with silver doors, or a silver Impala with black doors.
